com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.devicecontrol

Class Operation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.util.ExtensibleObject
      • com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.devicecontrol.Operation

  • public class Operation
extends ExtensibleObject
    An Operation is used to send operations to the device (or Thing in IoT terms).

    Created by Patrick Steinert on 31.01.16.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.util.ExtensibleObject

        public Operation()
        Constructor to create new operations.

      • Operation

        public Operation(String id)
        Creates an operation with an existing ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique identifier of the object.

    • Method Detail

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(OperationStatus status)
        Setting the status of the operation.
        Parameters:
        status - use OperationStatus value.

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Getting the unique identifier of the operation. If the operation was retrieved from the platform, it has an ID. If just created, there is no ID.
        Returns:
        String with the unique identifier of the operation or null if not available.

      • getCreationTime

        public Date getCreationTime()
        Getting the creation time of the operation, which is the timestamp when operation is stored in the CoT platform.
        Returns:
        a Date object representing the timestamp.

      • getStatus

        public OperationStatus getStatus()
        Getting the status of the Operation. Could throw an IllegalArgumentException if platform somehow returns invalid stuff (maybe added new states)
        Returns:
        a value of OperationStatus with the status.

      • getDeviceId

        public String getDeviceId()
        Getting the deviceId of the target device. The given device should execute the operation.
        Returns:
        a String with the unique identifier of the device.

      • setDeviceId

        public void setDeviceId(String deviceId)
        Setting the deviceId of the target device. The given device should execute the operation.
        Parameters:
        deviceId - the unique identifier of the target device.

      • setDeliveryType

        public void setDeliveryType(String deliveryType)
        Setting the deliveryType of the operation.
        Parameters:
        deliveryType - a String with delivery type, e.g. "SMS".

      • getDeliveryType

        public String getDeliveryType()
        Getting the deliveryType of the operation.
        Returns:
        a String with the delivery type, e.g. "SMS".

      • setFailureReason

        public void setFailureReason(String failureReason)
        Setting failure reason in case of failing
        Parameters:
        failureReason - a String with failure Reason, e.g. "Operation cancelled by user"

      • getFailureReason

        public String getFailureReason()
        Getting FailureReason. Makes only sense if status is 'FAILED'
        Returns:
        a String with the failure reason from the Operation
